artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsunajima Kamekichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), nos. 436.37, 436.40; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 279.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two images arranged vertically on one sheet; top image: seated man with one arm around a reclining woman, while a second woman pours a drink from a teapot into a bowl held in man's PR hand at center, with four foxes around figures; two foxes wear garments; stone shrine gate in ULQ; bottom image: grey and brown horses racing, with jockey on brown horse facing backwards, wearing red blouse, purple vest and white pants; jockey on grey horse being thrown; jockey in background falling from horse wears green and white striped pants, black vest and red blouse
dimension: 14 5/8 × 9 11/16 in. (37.15 × 24.61 cm) (sheet, vertical ōban (two uncut horizontal chūban))
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Crazy Pictures of Famous Places in Tokyo (Tōkyō kaika kyōga meishō 東京開化狂画名所)
signed: Top: 芳年戯墨 {Yoshitoshi giboku} | bottom: 応需芳年戯墨 {ōju Yoshitoshi giboku}
title: Top: Cheerful Foxes at the Mimeguri Shrine on the Banks of the Sumida River; Bottom: A famous jockey at Shōkonsha
